basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ Greetings! I'm Abdulahi Mohamud, a Seattle-based full-stack software developer with a strong background in cybersecurity. My expertise lies in programming languages like Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and Markdown. Additionally, I'm proficient in Somali, Arabic, and Kiswahili. I possess a track record of designing, testing, and deploying software programs and applications, coupled with extensive experience in troubleshooting and debugging existing software. Notable projects I've worked on include an Android application for BMI and weight loss tracking, a comprehensive full-stack communication web app, and a dynamic full-stack web application that assists users in discovering and sharing exciting recipes with other users. My qualifications encompass an Advanced Software Development certificate in Java with SpringMVC & Android from Code Fellows, along with an Associate of Science degree in Network Security Admin attained from Highline College.

projects.title: BetterMe
projects.description: Android application used to help user track BMI and weight loss while giving then workouts to do and has Built in gps to locate and route to nearest gym, park or supplements store

projects.title: Gwitr
projects.description: Java buit full-stack livecommunication web app that scalable to over 10,000+ users and allows users to follow and chat with other users. uses multiple RESTFUL APIs to populate data to help user experience.

projects.title: NextMeal
projects.description: NextMeal is a dynamic web application built using Java and Reactjs that helps users explore and discover delicious dining options. It provides comprehensive information about restaurants, including menu items, prices, and locations. With NextMeal, users can easily find their next culinary adventure and save their favorite spots for future visits.

experience.title: Software Developer Internship
technologies: Troubleshooting, debugging, maintaining and improving existing software
Testing and deploying programs and applications
Designing algorithms and flowcharts to create new software programs and systems
